trans-unit.source: HTTP Status Codes
trans-unit.target: HTTP Status Codes

trans-unit.source: HTTP Status Codes for DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: HTTP Status Codes for DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: This topic provides the HTTP status codes returned by the REST operations.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides the HTTP status codes returned by the REST operations.

trans-unit.source: Code
trans-unit.target: Code

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: 200 Ok
trans-unit.target: 200 Ok

trans-unit.source: One of the following REST operations were successful:
trans-unit.target: One of the following REST operations were successful:

trans-unit.source: GET on a resource.
trans-unit.target: GET on a resource.

trans-unit.source: PUT on a resource.
trans-unit.target: PUT on a resource.

trans-unit.source: POST on a DocumentDB SQL.
trans-unit.target: POST on a DocumentDB SQL.

trans-unit.source: POST on a stored procedure resource to execute the stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: POST on a stored procedure resource to execute the stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: 201 Created
trans-unit.target: 201 Created

trans-unit.source: A POST operation to create a resource is successful.
trans-unit.target: A POST operation to create a resource is successful.

trans-unit.source: 204 No Content
trans-unit.target: 204 No Content

trans-unit.source: The DELETE operation is successful.
trans-unit.target: The DELETE operation is successful.

trans-unit.source: 400 Bad Request
trans-unit.target: 400 Bad Request

trans-unit.source: The JSON, SQL, or JavaScript in the request body is invalid.
trans-unit.target: The JSON, SQL, or JavaScript in the request body is invalid.

trans-unit.source: In addition, a 400 can also be returned when the required properties of a resource are not present or set in the body of the POST or PUT on the resource.
trans-unit.target: In addition, a 400 can also be returned when the required properties of a resource are not present or set in the body of the POST or PUT on the resource.

trans-unit.source: 400 is also returned when the consistent level for a GET operation is overridden by a stronger consistency from the one set for the account.
trans-unit.target: 400 is also returned when the consistent level for a GET operation is overridden by a stronger consistency from the one set for the account.

trans-unit.source: 401 Unauthorized
trans-unit.target: 401 Unauthorized

trans-unit.source: Either the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>x-ms-date</legacyBold> header is not set.
trans-unit.target: Either the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>x-ms-date</legacyBold> header is not set.

trans-unit.source: 401 is also returned when the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> header is set to an invalid authorization token.
trans-unit.target: 401 is also returned when the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> header is set to an invalid authorization token.

trans-unit.source: 403 Forbidden
trans-unit.target: 403 Forbidden

trans-unit.source: The authorization token expired.
trans-unit.target: The authorization token expired.

trans-unit.source: 403 is also returned during a POST to create a resource when the resource quota has been reached.
trans-unit.target: 403 is also returned during a POST to create a resource when the resource quota has been reached.

trans-unit.source: To resolve this issue, unused resource should be removed.
trans-unit.target: To resolve this issue, unused resource should be removed.

trans-unit.source: Additional capacity units can also be purchased to increase some of the resource quotas.
trans-unit.target: Additional capacity units can also be purchased to increase some of the resource quotas.

trans-unit.source: For more information on limits and quota, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB Limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on limits and quota, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB Limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: 403s can also be returned when a stored procedure, trigger, or UDF has been flagged for high resource usage and blocked from execution.
trans-unit.target: 403s can also be returned when a stored procedure, trigger, or UDF has been flagged for high resource usage and blocked from execution.

trans-unit.source: 404 Not Found
trans-unit.target: 404 Not Found

trans-unit.source: The operation is attempting to act on a resource that no longer exists.
trans-unit.target: The operation is attempting to act on a resource that no longer exists.

trans-unit.source: For example, the resource may have already been deleted.
trans-unit.target: For example, the resource may have already been deleted.

trans-unit.source: 408 Request Timeout
trans-unit.target: 408 Request Timeout

trans-unit.source: The operation did not complete within the allotted amount of time.
trans-unit.target: The operation did not complete within the allotted amount of time.

trans-unit.source: This is returned when a stored procedure, trigger or UDF (within a query) does not complete execution within the maximum execution time.
trans-unit.target: This is returned when a stored procedure, trigger or UDF (within a query) does not complete execution within the maximum execution time.

trans-unit.source: 409 Conflict
trans-unit.target: 409 Conflict

trans-unit.source: The id provided for a resource on a PUT or POST operation has been taken by an existing resource.
trans-unit.target: The id provided for a resource on a PUT or POST operation has been taken by an existing resource.

trans-unit.source: Use another id for the resource to resolve this issue.
trans-unit.target: Use another id for the resource to resolve this issue.

trans-unit.source: 410 Gone
trans-unit.target: 410 Gone

trans-unit.source: The operation did not complete due to a transient reconfiguration of your DocumentDB collection.
trans-unit.target: The operation did not complete due to a transient reconfiguration of your DocumentDB collection.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request after retrieving the latest collection partition information from the DocumentDB Gateway.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request after retrieving the latest collection partition information from the DocumentDB Gateway.

trans-unit.source: This is handled automatically by the SDKs.
trans-unit.target: This is handled automatically by the SDKs.

trans-unit.source: 412 Precondition Failure
trans-unit.target: 412 Precondition Failure

trans-unit.source: The operation specified an eTag that is different from the version available at the server, i.e., an optimistic concurrency error.
trans-unit.target: The operation specified an eTag that is different from the version available at the server, i.e., an optimistic concurrency error.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request after reading the latest version of the resource and updating the eTag on the request.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request after reading the latest version of the resource and updating the eTag on the request.

trans-unit.source: 413 Entity Too Large
trans-unit.target: 413 Entity Too Large

trans-unit.source: The document size in the request exceeded the allowable document size for a request.
trans-unit.target: The document size in the request exceeded the allowable document size for a request.

trans-unit.source: The workaround is to break the document up into sub documents.
trans-unit.target: The workaround is to break the document up into sub documents.

trans-unit.source: For more information on document size limit, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB Limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on document size limit, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB Limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: 429 Too Many Request
trans-unit.target: 429 Too Many Request

trans-unit.source: The collection has exceeded the request units per second (RUs/second) limit.
trans-unit.target: The collection has exceeded the request units per second (RUs/second) limit.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request after the server specified retry after duration.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request after the server specified retry after duration.

trans-unit.source: This limit can be reached if:
trans-unit.target: This limit can be reached if:

trans-unit.source: If you have a high number of requestsIf the requests consume a high number of request units e.g., full scans.
trans-unit.target: If you have a high number of requestsIf the requests consume a high number of request units e.g., full scans.

trans-unit.source: To reduce or eliminate these errors, you can do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: To reduce or eliminate these errors, you can do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Upgrade the performance level of the collection, e.g., from S1 to S2 or S3.
trans-unit.target: Upgrade the performance level of the collection, e.g., from S1 to S2 or S3.

trans-unit.source: Implement programmatic retries on throttle.
trans-unit.target: Implement programmatic retries on throttle.

trans-unit.source: Tune requests to consume fewer request units by managing indexing policy or implementing paging.
trans-unit.target: Tune requests to consume fewer request units by managing indexing policy or implementing paging.

trans-unit.source: Provision additional collections and partition requests across them.
trans-unit.target: Provision additional collections and partition requests across them.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB documentation
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB documentation
